documents.content:
# California Real Estate Broker License Requirements (2026)

## Department of Real Estate (DRE)

### Basic Requirements
- **Age:** 18 years or older
- **Experience:** 2 years full-time as a licensed salesperson OR equivalent experience OR bachelor's degree with major in real estate
- **Education:** 360 hours (8 college-level courses)

### Required Pre-License Courses (360 hours total)

**5 Mandatory Courses:**
1. Real Estate Practice (must include implicit bias component - SB 1495)
2. Legal Aspects of Real Estate
3. Real Estate Finance
4. Real Estate Appraisal
5. Real Estate Economics OR Accounting

**3 Elective Courses** from approved list:
- Property Management
- Escrow
- Common Interest Developments
- Mortgage Loan Brokering
- Business Law
- Computer Applications in Real Estate
- And others from DRE-approved list

### Costs to Become Licensed
| Item | Cost |
|------|------|
| Pre-License Courses (8 courses) | $800 - $1,200 |
| State Examination Fee | $150 |
| License Application Fee | $450 |
| Live Scan Fingerprinting | $49 + rolling fee |
| **TOTAL INVESTMENT** | **$1,450 - $1,850** |

### Examination Details
- **Questions:** 200 multiple choice
- **Time:** 4 hours
- **Passing Score:** 75% (150 correct out of 200)
- **Pass Rate:** Approximately 40%
- **Difficulty:** More rigorous than salesperson exam

### Broker vs. Salesperson
| Aspect | Broker | Salesperson |
|--------|--------|-------------|
| Can work independently | Yes | No |
| Can supervise agents | Yes | No |
| Can operate own firm | Yes | No |
| Initial exam pass rate | ~40% | ~50% |
| Education hours | 360 | 135 |
| Experience required | 2 years | None |

### Official URLs
- Broker Requirements: https://www.dre.ca.gov/examinees/requirementsbroker.html
- Fees: https://www.dre.ca.gov/Fees/Fees.html
